name: Wood Stove Replacement Program
description: Up to $10,500 to replace wood-burning stove with electric heat pump ($6,500 base + $4,000 for Food Stamps/WIC/SSI recipients); or up to $1,000 for removal only; preference for disadvantaged communities
fullDescription: BAAQMD's Wood Stove Replacement Program helps Bay Area residents replace wood-burning stoves with clean electric heat pumps, improving air quality and reducing home heating costs.
whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $6,500 base incentive for heat pump replacement
- Additional $4,000 for Food Stamps/WIC/SSI recipients
- Up to $10,500 total for income-qualified households
- Up to $1,000 for removal only (no replacement)
- Priority for disadvantaged communities
- Covers installation costs
howToGetIt:
1. Sign up for program notifications on BAAQMD website
2. Must have wood-burning stove or fireplace
3. Apply when program reopens (January 13, 2026)
4. Submit income documentation if claiming additional rebate
5. Get approved and schedule installation
6. Receive incentive after project completion
address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105
keywords: wood stove, fireplace, BAAQMD, heat pump, replacement, air quality, $10500, Clean HEET
